item.title: Docker at AI Engineer Paris: Build and Secure AI Agents with Docker
item.description: üöÄ Last week, Docker participated in the inaugural AI Engineer Paris conference, highlighting the evolution of AI application development. Key discussions emphasized that true innovation requires rigorous engineering, not just “AI dust.” The focus is on creating robust AI agents through standardized practices. Docker’s Tushar Jain led a keynote on making AI agent development accessible to all developers. A hands-on workshop followed, teaching attendees how to build collaborative multi-agent…

item.title: Inside the AIPCon 8 Demos Redefining the Future of Enterprise AI
item.description: üöÄ AIPCon 8 showcased transformative AI applications across various industries, highlighting real-world solutions at Palantir’s recent conference. From healthcare to motorsport, demos featured innovations like Andretti’s RaceOS for rapid data-driven decisions and Nebraska Medicine’s automated documentation for efficient revenue cycle management. These advancements illustrate how AI can solve operational challenges and enhance efficiency. #EnterpriseAI #AIPCon8 #Innovation #Healthcare #Motorsport

item.title: Real-World IT Sustainability: 3 Case Studies From Green IO London
item.description: üåç The recent Green IO conference in London showcased how organizations like HSBC, OVO Energy, and the British government are implementing sustainable tech practices. HSBC shared their open-source tool for measuring software carbon footprints and their commitment to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050. OVO Energy highlighted innovative uses of home boilers for distributed computing. These case studies illustrate the tangible benefits of aligning environmental responsibility with business…

item.title: 3 Maxims for Great Developer Platform Design
item.description: Russell Miles shared insights on developer platform design at the Devmio International JavaScript Conference. üé∏ He outlined three maxims, starting with the idea that platforms require commitment and resources. If a company isn‚Äôt ready to invest, they may not need a platform. He emphasized that every organization already has a platform when they ship code. Understanding internal customers and viewing the platform as a product is crucial for success. #DeveloperPlatforms #JavaScript #Devmio…

item.title: How AI Can Help IT Teams Find the Signals in Alert Noise
item.description: üö® IT teams face a challenge with alert fatigue as 95-98% of alerts are often noncritical. This overwhelming noise can lead to burnout and decreased productivity. Mandi Walls from PagerDuty emphasized the need for better frameworks using SLOs, automation, and machine learning to improve alert management. Effective solutions can reduce stress and enhance the work environment for developers. #AlertFatigue #DevOps #MachineLearning #ITManagement #Productivity

item.title: Why Modern IT Operations Are Becoming More Like Space Travel
item.description: üöÄ The ManageEngine user conference in Las Vegas explored the link between IT operations and space travel. Former astronaut Mike Massimino shared insights on teamwork and problem-solving, drawing parallels between astronaut training and IT practices. He highlighted how both fields require trust in tools and collaboration among team members. Massimino’s experiences offered a fresh perspective on navigating challenges in IT, especially with the rise of AI. #ITOperations #SpaceTravel #Teamwork…

item.title: Discover How Heroku‚Äôs AI PaaS Delivers Real-World Results at Dreamforce

item.title: Conference Hopping: Training Attendee Scanning Def Con
item.description: üö® The Black Hat NOC faces unique challenges, as it operates in a cybersecurity hub where scanning and ethical hacking are expected. Cisco is enhancing security with network-based telemetry to monitor diverse personal devices at the conference. An alert recently identified suspicious activity linked to a training session targeting an external IP associated with Def Con. #Cybersecurity #BlackHat2025 #Cisco #ThreatDetection #EthicalHacking

item.title: Black Hat Training Attendees Scan Aviation Organization
item.description: üöÄ The Black Hat conference highlights the unique challenges of cybersecurity, particularly within its Security and Network Operations Center (NOC). This dynamic environment differs from typical corporate settings where such actions are seen as malicious. With a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) policy, comprehensive monitoring becomes challenging. The focus shifts to robust network-based telemetry for…

Key features include streamlined password management and a new Global Enrollment Policy to simplify onboarding. üîê…

item.title: Securing DNS With Umbrella at Black Hat
item.description: Cisco continues to enhance security at Black Hat, focusing on DNS monitoring since 2017. üåê With Umbrella, they route DNS traffic through a centralized service, gaining insights into potential threats like malware and phishing. At Black Hat USA 2025, encrypted DNS requests were blocked to improve visibility into user traffic. üîç The team prioritized monitoring the ApateWeb PUP delivery and phishing campaign, noting specific domain patterns. #Cisco #BlackHat2025 #CyberSecurity #DNS #Umbrella
